meanings.definition: A device that directs data packets between computer networks.
meanings.sent1: The router at home helps connect our computers to the internet.
meanings.sent2: I need to reset the router to fix the internet connection.
meanings.sent3: The router decided to take a break and stopped sending data packets.
meanings.sent4: She was like a router, guiding everyone to the right path in the digital world.
meanings.sent5: The router hummed softly as it worked tirelessly to direct the data packets.

meanings.definition: A tool used for hollowing out an area in a hard material.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a router to create intricate designs on the wooden table.
meanings.sent2: I borrowed a router from the workshop to carve out the edges of the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The router made a funny noise as it carved through the tough material.
meanings.sent4: Her precision with the router was like an artist sculpting a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The router whirred as it smoothly hollowed out the hard surface.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that routes or directs.
meanings.sent1: As the team captain, she was the router of their strategies on the field.
meanings.sent2: The GPS in the car acts as a router, guiding us to our destination.
meanings.sent3: The little robot toy pretended to be a router, directing its toy friends around.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a router, always finding the best path forward.
meanings.sent5: The old lighthouse served as a router, directing ships safely through the stormy seas.
